sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's Thursday the 13th of January. Good morning Europe. These are our top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: No breakthrough at security talks in Brussels as NATO rejects Russia's key demands. But diplomatic efforts continue today in Vienna.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson faces calls to resign after admitting that he did attend a party while the country was in lockdown.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And a New York judge rejects Prince Andrew's bid to have a civil suit against him thrown out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Now the British royal could face trial later this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: After four hours of tense talks, the US and NATO have rejected key Russian security demands for easing tensions over Ukraine, but are keeping the door open for future talks.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Speaking to Euronews, the US Deputy Secretary of State had a message from Moscow.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Anything is possible in the world. But I will say this.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It won't be about diplomacy failing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It will be about President Putin having made a choice that actually I think will bring great, great sorrow to his countrymen and women, because there will be great economic costs to Russia if they take this action.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I think he knows that.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: There is enormous solidarity, he will have heard this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: So he will know that we will be unified in imposing costs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: If he makes the wrong choice, I hope he makes the right one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Wendy Sherman told us she didn't expect to get instant answers from Russia this week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: That her efforts are part of a series of critical and important dialogues that will continue Thursday in Vienna.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: In an interview with Euronews, a firm, NATO's Secretary General said NATO would not be bowing to Russia's demands.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We are ready to agree on balanced and verifiable reductions in forces as part of conventional til Russias behov. Jens Stoltenberg fortalte oss at det fortsatt var en virkelig farge for en krig i Europa.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Maeve McMahon, Euronews, Brussels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Boris Johnson has issued an apology during a grilling at Wednesday's Prime Minister's questions. The Conservative leader explained that he thought the meeting on the 20th of May 2020 was a work event and spent 25 minutes in the garden before returning to the office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It happened during a time when the country was under strict lockdown regulations against COVID and therefore angered many.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Mr Speaker, I want to apologise.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: I have learned enough to know that there were things we simply did not get right.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And I must take responsibility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He went on to explain that the garden was an extension of the Downing Street office, but he did acknowledge that he should have done things differently.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The opposition leader, Keir Starmer, says it's a worthless apology.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Well, there we have it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: After months of deceit and deception, the pathetic spectacle of a man who's run out of road, is he now going to do the decent thing and resign?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: However, Boris Johnson made no mention of stepping down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: He only reiterated that everyone should wait for the results of the independent inquiry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, a High Court judge says that the UK government's operation of a VIP lane for suppliers of PPE equipment during the pandemic was illegal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Calls for Boris Johnson to resign are increasing, not just from the opposition parties, but from his own party as well now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: We've had Tory MPs coming out saying that he should go.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: One described him as being a dead man walking.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: That's similar to a description given to Theresa May, a dead woman walking, shortly before she was forced to leave office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Now, Boris Johnson has apologised. he has said he's responsible for what happened but he's still offering the defence that he believed this was a work gathering and he's urging people to wait until this inquiry is over. Certainly no sign of him resigning just yet so he could do that in the next week or two ahead of the inquiry result or perhaps wait till that comes through or he could perhaps face a vote of no confidence if enough MPs demand that. Equally, he could try and stick it out. He could try and refocus the public's mind onto issues such as the COVID vaccination programme, for example, or the cost of living, which is another big hurdle looming for him to face. Certainly, the British public has showed anger, fury, outrage, disgust, call it what you will.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: One member of a COVID-19 bereaved families group says that her father, the death certificate that was being signed for him on the day of this so-called party, that she then met Boris Johnson in the summer in the gardens here behind Downing Street and he looked her in the eye and said he'd done everything he could for people like her dad so there's plenty of outrage here because people that stuck to the rules were unable perhaps to visit their loved ones before they died so we wait to see what's going to happen how long the inquiry will take and whether those calls for him to resign will actually achieve that effect

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: achieve that effect. British royal Prince Andrew will face a civil lawsuit in the United States over allegations he sexually assaulted an underage girl.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A New York judge on Wednesday rejected Andrew's bid to have the case thrown out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Virginia Dufresne is taking the prince to court over accusations he abused her when she was 17 years old.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: She says she was trafficked by the late convicted paedophile Jeffrey Epstein, a friend of the prince.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Epstein's ex-girlfriend, Jilin Maxwell, also a friend of the prince, was convicted.S. court last month on sex trafficking charges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Our reporter Susan Tehrani has more from New York.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Really a last-ditch effort on the part of Prince Andrew and his lawyers to try to toss this case.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: First, it was an attempt to claim that Virginia Joffrey doesn't live in the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: She's not a citizen. That didn't go through.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And for the second time, it was this attempt to say that a settlement had been reached between Jeffrey Epstein and Virginia Joffrey back in 2009.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And perhaps that was a cause to throw this case away.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It did not work uh the judge today said that in the ruling part of the case it said quote uh this lawsuit alleges discrete incidents of sexual abuse in particular circumstances at three identifiable locations it identifies to whom it attributes that sexual abuse, end of quote. So at this point, Prince Andrew has until July 14th to potentially answer questions under oath, and if a settlement is not reached, the trial will go to court, and a jury trial will take place later this year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: place later this year. The UK has reported nearly 400 new deaths from Covid. It's the second day in a row that

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: the daily figure has hit an 11-month high. Wednesday's number hasn't been reached since February 24 last year when 442 deaths were reported. The WHO has urged people not to be complacent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: While Omicron causes less severe disease than Delta, it remains a dangerous virus, particularly for those who are unvaccinated. Denmark is to offer a fourth coronavirus vaccination to vulnerable citizens as it faces record infection numbers from the omicron variant however the european union's drug regulator has expressed doubts about the need for a fourth dose and said there was currently no data to support this approach switzerland is to halve its quarantine time to five days to tackle its wave of COVID infections that's threatening to derail the economy. The reduction comes into effect from today. The government says it's possible because the Omicron variant has a shortened time between infection and transmission.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And in France, schools have closed their doors ahead of a nationwide strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Teachers are frustrated with what they say is the constant changing of Covid rules by the government. Testing and isolation requirements for potential Covid cases are disrupting classes, making teaching unmanageable.
